metatag.description: In service of humanity, Emory College is reimagining the liberal arts and sciences and revolutionizing the student experience, bridging the disciplines to address global challenges.

props.header: In service of humanity, Emory College is reimagining the liberal arts and sciences and revolutionizing the student experience, bridging the disciplines to address global challenges.
props.text:
In an economy where disruption and rapid change are constants, the liberal arts and sciences are more essential than ever. They draw students out of their individual experiences into the wide world of ideas, provide ethical understanding, and teach both critical and creative thinking. Students emerge from Emory College more human and more humane, with the moral imagination to address larger issues with clarity and compassion.

Emory does an artful job of educating students by harnessing both the strengths of a liberal arts college and the expertise of a research university. This powerful combination creates purpose-driven alumni who approach the world as problem-solvers, communicators, and leaders for a lifetime.

props.text: When we have entire swaths of human beings who are denied the education that they need in order to thrive in this society, it does damage. We cannot be willing to accept that as the norm.—Carol Anderson, Charles Howard Candler Professor and Chair, African American Studies.
Emory College of Arts and Sciences has a range of priorities for 2O36.

props.title: Professorships in key departments and retention chairs for early to mid-career faculty members, as well as graduate student and start-up support
props.body: We seek to endow nine new distinguished professorships and to provide those professorships with support for graduate students. We also seek to create ten endowed professorships for mid-career faculty that will allow us to retain rising stars — recruited faculty who are in danger of considering other universities. This effort will result in more Emory faculty serving as international commentators on the most important issues of our times in forums that define public scholarship and increase the number of faculty who are members of international academies.

props.title: Faculty fellowships and residencies in the arts, including creative writing, and film
props.body: We will build upon existing teaching and research strengths in the arts and a variety of disciplines and create meaningful collaborations with Atlanta by investing in visiting artists, fellows, teaching, and experiences that bring art into the classroom and community. The effort will enhance the undergraduate experience, expand opportunities for collaboration from the health sciences to business, and create meaningful collaboration. We will lead the national creative conversation through the work of our students, faculty, graduates, and those who choose to come here to perform and teach for a day or for a year.

props.title: Naming gifts and undergraduate fellowships at Institute for the Liberal Arts
props.body: Emory College has several leading programs that could extend their reach with an endowment that would carry with it a naming opportunity, specifically for the Department of Quantitative Theory and Methods, Center for the Study of Human Health, Department of African American Studies, and the Creative Writing Program. These are educational programs that are rooted in the work of top research faculty, and all are destinations for undergraduate students throughout the nation.

props.text:
Our outstanding 550-member faculty guide students as they explore widely and dive deeply into their own interests and our research priorities. Post-doctoral researchers play an important role in the undergraduate college, bringing fresh ideas and driving new thought.

Emory College boasts 50 departments and programs, several of which have achieved a national reputation. We offer 86 majors and 63 minors — rigorous courses of study that emphasize critical thinking, asking bold questions, and expanding the boundaries of knowledge. Students continue their education outside of the classroom with experiential learning like internships, undergraduate research, entrepreneurial experiences, and study abroad.
